function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Differences in influenza incidence versus meteorological conditions findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inconsistent transmission results in animal models","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid forced airflow rates affecting virus exposure time","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influenza virus survival prediction may be inaccurate due to different models and variable parameters","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistencies in the impact of rh, temperature, and ah on virus survival may lead to misinterpretation of risk factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Caution against drawing conclusions about virus survival under real-world conditions based on laboratory-based studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting results between current study and previous studies regarding the impact of absolute humidity on influenza virus survival","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of statistical models and their implications for influenza seasonality","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overreliance on p-values to determine the influence of environmental variables on influenza seasonality","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation between temperature and ah impacting viability prediction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Multicollinearity in regression model","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poor fit at higher temperatures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Slight curvature in the relationship with ah","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rh alone is a poor predictor of viability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influenza virus stability is compromised at higher temperatures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlated independent variables in linear regression models can lead to inflated variances of estimated coefficients and inaccurate predictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Nonlinear relationship between virus viability and absolute humidity ah","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Thermal denaturation of proteins and nucleic acids as mechanisms of virus inactivation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of humidity on survival of viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disparities in results due to differences in suspension media for virus studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through respiratory aerosols and surfactants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of temperature and humidity on virus survival","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Thermal degradation of influenza virus in various systems aerosols, droplets, surfaces, etc.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of statistical models for virus viability analysis may lead to inaccurate predictions and conclusions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate parametrization of the relationship between relative humidity rh and droplet size could lead to misinterpretation of aerosol behavior and transmission dynamics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of the relationship between rh and absolute humidity ah could lead to errors in humidity control measures and disease transmission mitigation strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Evidence that temperature modulates influenza virus survival independent of humidity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influenza transmission between humans takes place indoors within a narrow range of temperatures, where ah and rh move in tandem","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relationship between rh and transmission via droplets and aerosols, where rh affects their physics and chemistry","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the relationship between rh and ah may lead to misinterpretation of humidity’s role in disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incorrect interpretation of humidity levels may result in ineffective virus survival predictions and seasonality assessments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misunderstanding the impact of temperature on the relationship between ah and rh can lead to misinterpretation of environmental risk factors for disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for occupancy rates and physical distancing in strategies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak sustainability approach of srs promoting economic development over natural capitals","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent consideration of food and vaccines implications in fitwel","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Irregular circadian rhythm and concomitant pathologies weaken the immune system, increasing susceptibility to infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of detailed strategies for social distancing and maximum occupancy in buildings, increasing the risk of airborne cross-infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Buildings viewed as facilitators of disease spread due to inadequate policies and measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission within built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strategies related to the built environment have a higher environmental and economic impact, thus their environmental and economic sustainability is lower","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"During emergency situations such as pandemics, strategies referred to the built environment may be adopted in order to guarantee the normal building operation and business continuity","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates in the built environment may lead to higher energy consumption and emissions, contributing to poor air quality and potentially impacting people’s health","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Company policies are typically preventive measures, easier to implement, and likely to be adopted at early stages","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measures applied to the built environment are typically corrective and may be challenging to implement during an emergency","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussion of indoor environment strategies and their impact on building operations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incompatibility of strategies between different certification categories fitwel, well, leed","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate measurement of airborne viruses in real-time","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased capability to measure sustainability in the long term","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficult integration among different sustainability criteria","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Industry demand for strategies to mitigate viral transmission due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient strategies to minimize the spread of infectious respiratory diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
